byline.contributor: Vindu Goel contributed reporting from San Francisco.

abstract: Facebook announces abrupt government shutdown of Free Basics, program providing over three million Egyptians with free access to Internet; order comes as government of Pres Abdel Fattah El-Sisi steps up efforts to curtail any possible protests on January 25, anniversary of Arab Spring uprising that led to ouster of former Pres Hosni Mubarak.
lead_paragraph: The program, Free Basics, began in October and had drawn more than three million Egyptians.

headline.main: Egypt Officials Stop Facebook Program for Free Access to Internet
headline.print_headline: Egypt Officials Shut Service for Free Access to Internet

snippet: The program, Free Basics, began in October and had drawn more than three million Egyptians.
